post_text: I was walking through medieval cellars that were continually getting tighter, in one instance I even had to squeeze through. on the floors, there laid a number of turtles, some on their back, some about to fall, and some just lying normally. Their heads were scaly, some reminiscent of a dragon. When I got out of the cellar I found myself on a town square. It was evening, lights dim with some shadows flying around. Only one shadow was dense and round. It wore a blue and white jacket with a masquerade mask. I provocatively yelled at it "Hey death!" It noticed me and started slowly and ominously chasing me. Suddenly, a girl clad in a celebratory village dress. She said that "It´s starting" and took me inside of a room that was connected with the town square. A great iron gate with bars was closed behind me. More girls who had the same dress were inside. Clergymen started a prayer, yet I did not know the words. I felt ashamed, anxious, and the shadow was staring at me hauntingly. Then a dance started, I did not know the moves, I was being pushed around, I even pushed off a glass that broke. Everyone was dancing on the glass shards and clothes that looked like mine that weren't there before. The Clergymen were watching me disapprovingly. The women did not care, they were happy that I was trying to dance with them. After the dance, I started picking up the shards and cut myself accidentally. My blood was not dense, and it was watery. After the cut, my father called me and asked me how I was.
comment_text: The dark, ominous "shadow" chasing you was your Shadow, in the Jungian sense - all the things which you reject and repress in yourself. Jung would say the turtle is a common symbol of the Self, a turtle on it's back or about to fall might represent a less than ideal state of the Self, one in need of/lacking help. He has also described the turtle as representing the transcendent function, that which unites the opposites. Jung has also said reptile-like scales - and the dragon - are associated with the sympathetic nervous system. Incidentally, the sympathetic nervous system is what constricts blood vessels, allowing them to move through smaller spaces under pressure, as you were in this dream. I wonder whether your blood taking on a watery quality is somehow also related. You said you woke up cold. vasoconstriction of the blood vessels is what keeps you warm when cold. Ordinarily, blood is associated with emotion, in Jungian interpretations. To me, this dream seems like it might be about integration of the personal Shadow, in order to aid the development of the Self, but given your point about watery blood, crawling along constricted routes, and waking up cold, I wonder whether this dream is simply a response to your physical state at the time of the dream.

There is a very classic interpretation by Jung (one of his own dreams if I remember correctly) where he interpreted a house in a dream as an image if the mind. The basement is the subconscious. Deep beneath the house is the collective unconscious, where dragons and monsters dwell. These are the complexes of the collective unconscious, the things that you need to face in order to mature as a human being. Tod Venn mentions the dragons and Shadow above. The village and traditional clothing also sounds as relating to the collective subconscious. I think Peterson would say that this relates to drives that are collective to us as humans, and sometimes older that Homo Sapiens. There is a conflict here between the feminine (the women) and a religious and/or patriarchal authority (clergy, your father). There appears to be a situation that is out of your control; the dancing on broken glass, closed gates, you are pushed around and don't know the moves. Maybe some kind of ecstatic feeling of being out of control. Maybe you need to learn to let go? post_text: I was a fish, I was lost in the sewers, and I was guided by another fish, I believe. I could hear its voice. It led me trough the dirty water, towards the ocean. post_text: I'm in the kitchen of an apartment I shared with my younger brother Bob (now in prison) in Dubuque, Iowa, many years ago but there are no walls or ceilings; it is overlayed by a sunny savannah...grass and some trees. I'm getting some things together to camp out and go to bed in the "kitchen." I've gathered up grasses, a pillow, and am looking for a blanket of some kind. As I work, a lion cub emerges from some trees to the south, approaches me, and licks my left hand. I find myself alert to the likelihood that the mother lion is nearby. I scan the horizon and, sure enough, a VERY large mother lion saunters from some trees to the west through the remnants of the apartment's living room. She doesn't seem to key in on me as a threat. I freeze, hoping she and the cub will just move on. Slowly I hunker down into the bedding I've gathered up in the kitchen area. The lioness approaches me and sniffs my belly. I slowly curl into a ball on the bedding, sensing that I'm in a life or death situation. The lioness yawns and lays right over the top of me. I instantly find myself feeling warm, nested, and comfortable-\-\safe for now. I let myself relax, thinking she'll guard me while I sleep but am also wondering if I'll be safe when we all wake in the morning because I wonder if she'll be hungry then and that she's just holding me to be eaten in the morning.
comment_text: In my opinion, this is you coming to a different state of healing. You’re taking on your own fears, and at the same time fearing that state of mind. The fact that the lion trusted you to lay down or their cub I hope instills the fact that sure healing and conquering your fears. Put that in itself can be a scary place. As if the lion will eat you the next morning. Keep the hope alive, keep strong.

post_text: I found myself in a hospital room. I don't know how I got there or why I was there, the room was pleasantly sunny. When he left I was visited by yet another man, my ex partner. I don't recall if there was any conversation but the spirits were high and there was also no sense of distress to the situation, it was like meeting an old friend that you still hold a lot of affection for because you simply like the person. Then he also left. Now off to the part I'm most intrigued about. When I was left alone the feeling of a quiet contentment persisted. I found myself holding up a small mirror and looked into it. To my absolute surprise, my face above the eye line was split open. The opening starting from around the space between my eyebrows. I recall the skin hanging to the right side (in the mirror). I was surprised but nowhere near in a state in which I would be if this happened to me in real life. Trust me, I like my face the way it is. In the dream the feeling was that of curiosity. I looked inside my head and there to the right I found two pieces of some type of long, beige, spongy material. I was under the impression that I had undergone a brain surgery and the pieces were there to hold the hemisphere in place. What's worth noticing is that I felt the operation happened years earlier and wasn't the reason I was now in the hospital room. Another thing I very strongly recall is that my left (in the mirror) side of the brain was hurting me, it was inflamed. I had to wake up at that point as I don't recall anything past that.

post_text: I'm planting potatoes. It seems to be nighttime. I feel lightheaded so I sit down then lay down on the ground. There are other people around. A short older man sees that I need help but thinks I need help getting back up whereas I just need to lay there for a minute so I don't faint. He squeezes me around the chest to try to support me. At first I pretend to accept his help to be nice and start to sit up, but the squeezing makes me feel more lightheaded and I panic thinking I will faint and yell "Let go! Let go! Let go!" Or something like that. The man releases his grip immediately but it doesn't seem fast enough. I am still planting potatoes but now it is day time and I'm just with my mom. I am in the process of planting the potatoes at the ends of a row of garden beds. It occurs to me that I hadn't asked my mom if this is okay and they are her garden beds. I ask her and she says it's fine and I can plant them wherever there is room. She asks me how many pounds of potatoes I had grown last year. I said I didn't know because I hadn't weighed them because I remembered I hadn't harvested them all at once but little by little as I thought they were ready. In the dream this seems to be the third year in a row I have planted potatoes."
comment_text: I think you've been doing something for a long time, probably longer than 3 years, that is helping you and others plant for harvest. Sometimes you need help, but oftentimes you just need company and rest. Most people are well-meaning, but if they're unhelpful, if you teach them how they can be more helpful, they'll be more helpful once they get it. Also, sometimes it seems to be nighttime, when it's just that you're weary and not with the right company and rest. When you get the right company and rest, it feels more like daytime, because we have more energy, whether it is or isn't literally. I'd say make sure your mom knows you appreciate her too. A saying comes to mind, "Don't grow weary in doing well, because in due time, you will reap a harvest." Never underestimate planting, no matter how long that season lasts. Keep doing as well as you know in every worthwhile endeavor, and it is actually impossible for that not to pay off. In due time is frustrating, but the patience you learn and later the timing of the reward will be impeccable.

At first it looked like the bird had the snake, but the snake twisted out and got free. The bird attacked again, and this time the snake bit the bird as they were struggling. The bird dropped the snake, and the snake bit me, before the bird grabbed it again. I was initially worried, as I've encountered snakes a lot in my last job, but then realised it was probably too small to hurt me. I didn't recognise the species of bird or snake, but the snake wasnt big (30-40cm).
comment_text: The stairs allow you to move from one level to another level, in this case it might mean ascending to a spiritual level since you arrive at the road on top of the stairs. The road takes you on a pathway to a new place however it’s the journey that is highlighted here. Your dream and your comments reveal 2 figures who have some understanding about snakes. You have said that “I’ve encountered snakes in my last job”. As well the bird in her job also encounters snakes in her job. The bird knows her job with snakes well. She doesn’t muck around she attacks the seemingly small snake 3 times. Let’s look. Firstly she reveals the snake “hiding in the grass” the bird takes no chances she will either eat the snake or act protectively since she knows the snake is a threat to her family. You on the other hand look at the snake and because of its small size deem it harmless. Note the difference between you and the bird. The next thing we notice is what happens in the pursuing 3 attacks. On the first attack the birds keen eye for danger reveals the hiding place of the snake “the short grass” which is beside the road you use to take this new journey. The short grass suggests it’s drought resistant quality however not quite enough coverage to escape the keen eyesight of the bird who is always on guard. The bird is teaching you what to look for and how to behave on your journey since the small size does not cause her to see the snake as harmless. The bird attacks the first time but the snake by changing its shape manages to find a way out of the birds beak. The snakes is adaptable firstly hiding in short grass then when cornered simply twisting itself or changes its shape to release itself. The second attack is different, the bird and the snake struggle but the “harmless snake” actually bites the bird causing the bird to drop the snake in front of you. Now the snake is fully exposed right in front of your eyes and what does it do, it now bites you because as as the bird is a threat so too are you a potential threat but unlike the bird you still see the snake as harmless until you also get bitten. So I said the bird is teaching you not to see the small snake as entirely harmless. The bird attacks the snake for the third time after having bitten both of you and still the struggle goes on. In your last job, before you climbed the stairs you worked with snakes enough to know that small snakes don’t pose a real threat however after you climb to the staircase you still apply the same logic in the same old way but the behaviour of the bird now teaches you something new, that is in your new life journey you might consider that even small snakes can hide in short grass and still have the capacity to bite especially once they are exposed.

I guess from a Jungian perspective the girl/s could be seen as your anima symbols, and the dark underground perhaps your deep unconscious. The surprise assassin is an interesting twist. I love how dreams, though supposedly coming from our own minds, can spin a story and lead us to a point without us suspecting what's about to happen, then surprise us! A 'friend' being someone that they are related to, a repressed aspect of ourselves sure, symbolized as someone dormant, sleeping. I guess what you said at the start, that the people below ground, 'we were there to defend ourselves'. That too sounds like the way people judge against/ repress certain traits, as when people try to repress an aggressive side to survive in polite society.

post_text: I was at the edge of a river. The river wasn't among greenery, nor in open landscape, but was enclosed, steeped up both sides, perhaps by rock, the other side was vertical as a wall, the side I was on sloped more gradually down to the waters edge. On the far side was a large wooden boat, its hull was standing tall many meters above the waters surface with many life size wooden figures on it like a carved sculpture, the boat was fixed in place, as were the wooden figures. To my right, on the side of the river I was on, was a much smaller boat, and again there were wooden figurines which where positioned in a line as though walking toward the direction of the front of the boat, again fixed still, inanimate, those towards the back of the procession were above the water level, those towards the front progressively submerged as though depicting them walking into and beneath the water. Perhaps they were not actually on the little boat, or perhaps the boat too was submerged at the front, I think the boat was on top of the water, but the procession of wooden figurines were walking into the river in front of the little boat. I noticed a woman unknown to me, who was wearing brown/red earthy colored clothes, and I sat down at the side of the river bank, sitting in the shallow water there, with a sense of some sexual connotation by doing so.
comment_text: It strikes me as a comparison dream with the two sides of the river, the sloped vs the cliff, along with the small vs the large boat. So given what you say about low self worth I am guessing that you are comparing yourself to others to measure your own worth? But in so doing you are looking at still images - moments in time, the wooden still figure that doesn't take in the "full slope" of their being? You seem the at their peak, the cliff, the top, but not seeing their failures? The low points are submerged below the surface of the water while on your side you are seeing the whole slope, the dizzying highs, the terrifying lows, and the creamy middles. Earth girl is inviting you to mix with the water, seems alchemical in nature. Inviting to mix conscious and unconscious, or body and spirit? I find it confusing but hopefully you could make sense of that?

post_text: Came to discover that I was being asked to participate in a wedding, and I came to find out that it was my wife, or someone like her, getting married at the church my ex-wife and I used to attend. There was an apartment full of my ex-wife and her siblings, but they weren’t her real siblings. They were in the process of moving out of the apartment. I was there, frantically going from person to person, trying to figure out what was going on. It seemed to everyone like the most natural thing in the world, and my vehement protest was viewed as outlandish and inappropriate. I was distraught and desperately tried to make them see. “What is going on!?” Then I was riding a horse through a sort of natural area, a national park. I saw that some belts had been discarded. I picked one up like a whip. I rode my horse downhill. It was hilly country, with grass and water and a view of a far distant country at a lower elevation. Then I was back at the apartment. There was a Asian person there, of ambiguous gender. I asked this person to come back to the bedroom with the aim of seducing them. They didn’t know what I wanted and they got uncomfortable and finally said “oh, for some reason I thought you wanted to...” then my ex-wife’s sister came back (but not the real one) and we looked out the back window to see that there was a small prototype fighter jet being worked on by a couple of people, a woman and some children. “Jet fuel?” I asked. “That would be your low-grade test fuel,” the sister replied matter-of-factly.
comment_text: Nice to hear you had a wedding to attend, which may symbolise the integration of a complex into the psyche if which you have no conscious idea. If not already integrated and known , perhaps the relationships with ex and Asian point the way, and low grade jet fuel a slow process.

post_text: I was in the basement of my parents house, but different. It looked like when I was 6 years old, with lots of my old toys that had since been removed. There were also many TVs and electronics that were there that never had been. I had come down to work on them, but also to escape some rowdy party going on upstairs. A girl came down, who happened to be a girl I had a crush on back in high school, and she started talking to me. I did my best to ignore her and focus on my work, but I eventually started hesitantly talking back. Before I knew it, we were running around the basement, playing with toys, flinging ping pong balls at each other. We started to get closer and closer, though I kept my distance best I could. I began to desire her, and our lips kept getting closer, but I stopped myself each time because I knew she had a boyfriend. Two of her friends showed up, people I hadn’t gotten along with in real life, but got along fine with in the dream. Eventually i felt it was time to go, so I decided to say goodbye and end our game. One of my crush’s friends said to her, “would you like to steal a kiss before we go?” My crush looked at me, and we shared a soft peck on the lips. We paused, and then suddenly we were making out, and I was lifting her up in my arms and spinning her around. It was the happiest I’d been in a while. Then a voice said “time to go,” and I was sucked into darkness.
comment_text: Seems like your subconscious is trying to tell you to be more assertive or confident. To take more action towards what you want and not be as hesitant. Is there anything you are not actively pursuing that you know you want to/should pursue? It doesn't necessarily have to be a girl. Maybe its time to go for that job promotion you've been thinking about? It sounds to me like your dream had a functional task to strengthen your memory of your childhood; perhaps important attitudes and perspectives that had been lost. You were down in the childhood basement avoiding the loud sound of the party upstairs and actively rewiring your connection to the past. This girl came up in the process and her less than friendly friends. You got to play with the old attraction and even repaired the uncomfortable discord with her friends, in a semi-lucid way, but that wasn't the primary purpose of the dream and had gone right to that sweet point of, "enough" and maybe "on the edge of distraction", so you were pulled up.
background_info: I haven’t seen/spoken to the girls in the dream in years.

post_text: I had sliced 1-2 inch lines all over my body, slanting in random directions, and inserted fractions of leaves in each one. The idea was that this was important and should be done. I don't remember why. There was no blood or gore. Minimal pain. (I have been playing with an arrowhead and a plastic tablecloth the previous evening). The torn leaves were somewhat thinner than kaffir lime leaves. After they had set flat with my skin between its layers for some time, they were to be removed. And I started removing them by reopening the cuts, and using my fingernails to get a grip. I had removed them from my left side, when I took a break for some reason and thougt, "I hope these don't heal into my right side", though without real anxiety. There was nothing gory under the surface. Just slightly more intimate layers of skin. There was pain. I don't recall cutting or removing them from my neck or torso, but definitely my arms and legs.

Then I went to this share house, upstairs where I was supposed to be living: talked to my housemates and did some other things I couldn’t recall, but I’m pretty sure those parts were fun that I forgot about the guy in the green shirt. I climbed the staircase and opened the door at the end and there I was on the rooftop smoking another cigarette. This share house was relatively taller than most buildings that I could watch the neighbors through their windows, the street market and the people walking around. It felt very calm. Then this woman busted out of the door - also wearing a green shirt - shaking and crying, begging for help. This woman was bleeding all over and I could see one of her eyes sticking out of her face with a huge open wound on her temple showing her cracked skull. I asked her what happened and she said “he’s here”. Then I remembered the man with a green shirt. Then the mood of that dream turned into something out of a horror movie. The sky turned blood red. The people around were shouting “watch out! Lock your doors!”, warning the others including me. The commotion kept getting closer and closer; the kind of noise you would hear from people screaming in terror. Then I heard loud thuds inside the share house and the footsteps on the staircase. I realized that he was after the woman. I shouted at the neighbors to call the cops. I locked the door on the rooftop from the outside with just a slide lock using a concrete nail as the barrel bolt. post_text: I was in my childhood home. I walked into the living room and my Grandfather (who is passed) was standing looking out the window with his arms crossed. I went to the window to see what he was looking at because there was a strange glow coming from outside. I stood beside my Grandfather, who didn’t say a word. Or move for that matter. It was snowing, but the snow was almost shaped like a curved peanut in the shell and it was cascading down, heavily, in a back and forth motion that would resemble a feather floating down. I was a bit anxious about it and I heard my Mother angrily tell me— from somewhere in the background that it was just snow and that I was being ridiculous. I tried telling her that it wasn’t normal, she wouldn’t look. I looked up at the sky and the clouds were huge and heavy and oddly close to the ground. That’s actually when my Grandfather spoke and told me that it was because there was a lack of some crucial element in the atmosphere, that something as wrong.
comment_text: Maybe you’re feeling uneasy in your current life because of something that seems obviously off, but there’s a part of you (maybe who learned from your mother) that believes you’re overreacting and that if you just ignore it, it’s not that big of a deal. And then the part of you (maybe who learned from your grandfather) that believes this strange weather is truly indicative of something going wrong, since he can see it too. Maybe it’s a reminder that when you come across something that is obviously incorrect, it is better to take action to see what it’s about and what needs to be done with it. Maybe it’s a reminder to trust your instinct, because you know deep down when something is bad.
